title: Death Penalty - Death Penalty (2014)
description:
Death Penalty is a band formed in 2013 by ex-Cathedral guitarist Garry Ã¢â‚¬Å“GazÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ Jennings, featuring Belgian female vocalist Michelle Nocon (ex-Serpentcult).

SheÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s ridden to the SabbathÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ SheÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s made love to the DevilÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ She is a witch!

Arising from the still warm ashes of UK doom legends Cathedral, Death Penalty is the newborn brainchild of lead guitarist extraordinaire Gaz Jennings. Enlisting the talents of former Serpentcult singer Michelle Nocon, current Serpentcult drummer Frederik Cosemans, and TortureramaÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s bassist Raf Meukens, the Anglo-Belgian assembly is ready to conquer Europe. Hot on the heels of the ridiculously catchy 7Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ Sign Of Times, their self-titled debut promises a fiery explosion of doom & roll.

After the short instrumental Ã¢â‚¬Å“Grotesque HorizonÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ the stage is set for the witchesÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ Sabbath. NoconÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s pipes are intense and carry a punk rock attitude, with JenningsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ heavy metal riffs ramping up the aggression from the comparably safe-sounding 7Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½. Despite the bandÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s moniker, the opening tracks of Death Penalty sound closer to an Iron Maiden, or even a Manilla Road, than the gloom of Witchfinder General. The galloping Ã¢â‚¬Å“Eyes Of The HereticÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ is an early highlight, featuring an achingly addictive chorus, thundering riffs and a brilliant vocal performance. In my review of Sign Of Times I lamented the rather anonymous rhythm-section. Here it all comes together excellently, letting both Coseman and Meukens step out of JenningsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ long shadow. As a result, the group feels less like a solo-project and more like a proper band.

With such a riff-machine at their helm itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s unsurprising that Death Penalty is bursting with excellent hooks. Besides instant earworms such as the MotÃƒÂ¶rhead-esque Ã¢â‚¬Å“Immortal By Your HandÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½, the band occasionally slows down to a menacing doom metal crawl. Rather than coming off as simply Cathedral with a female singer, Death Penalty are actively pursuing a sound of their own, with songs that feel tailored for NoconÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s haunting voice. Changing up the formula proves a winning strategy; crushing moments like Ã¢â‚¬Å“The One That DwellsÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ ring out eerily when paired with the remarkably infectious melodies of the fantastic closing number Ã¢â‚¬Å“Written By The InsaneÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½. This constant interplay between the energetic and the hefty pays off; an hour feels like minutes when under the spell of Death Penalty.

Expanding on the promising Sign Of Times, Death Penalty have proven their worth with a towering collection of hard-rocking tunes and deafening doom metal. An utter joy of an album, Death Penalty will leave you humming for days. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s another solid addition to the already breathtaking roster of Rise Above Records, and a damn fine slice of doom.

2014 Death Penalty
